item.title: Jen add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Jen add a quote by Bell Hooks
item.description: "As all advocates of feminist politics know most people do not understand sexism or if they do they think it is not a problem. Masses of people think that feminism is always and only about women seeking to be equal to men. And a huge majority of these folks think feminism is anti-male. Their misunderstanding of feminist politics reflects the reality that most folks learn about feminism from patriarchal mass media." -- Bell Hooks

item.title: Jen add a quote by Bell Hooks
item.description: "For most people, what is so painful about reading is that you read something and you don't have anybody to share it with. In part what the book club opens up is that people can read a book and then have someone else to talk about it with. Then they see that a book can lead to the pleasure of conversation, that the solitary act of reading can actually be a part of the path to communion and community." -- Bell Hooks

item.title: Jen add a quote by Sharon Salzberg
item.description: "We use mindfulness to observe the way we cling to pleasant experiences & push away unpleasant ones." -- Sharon Salzberg
